001package imagingbook.lib.math.eigen;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
004import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
005
006import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
007import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
008
009/**
010 * Calculates eigenvalues and eigenvectors of square matrices of arbitrary size.
011 * Eigenvalues are sorted by magnitude (in descending order). A matrix may have
012 * complex eigenvalues but only real eigenvalues (and their associated
013 * eigenvectors) are considered. 
014 * Associated eigenvalues and eigenvectors share the same index (k = 0,...,N-1)
015 * but are not sorted in any particular order.
016 * Uses class {@link EigenDecomposition} of the
017 * Apache Commons Math (3) library.
018 * <br>
019 * Usage example (retrieving all eigenvalues and associated eigenvectors):
020 * <pre>
021 * double[][] A = {
022 *      { 5, 2, 0, 1 },
023 *      { 2, 5, 0, 7 },
024 *      { -3, 4, 6, 0 },
025 *      { 1, 2, 3, 4 }};
026 * 
027 * RealEigensolver solver = new EigensolverNxN(A);
028 * 
029 * double[] eigenvals = solver.getEigenvalues();
030 * for (int k = 0; k &lt; solver.getSize(); k++) {
031 *      double lambda = solver.getEigenvalue(k);
032 *      if (Double.isFinite(lambda)) {
033 *              double[] x = solver.getEigenvector(k);
034 *              ...
035 *      }
036 * }</pre>
037 * 
038 * @author WB
039 * @version 2021/11/25
040 */
041public class EigensolverNxN implements RealEigensolver {
042
043        private final int n;
044        private final EigenDecomposition ed;
045        private final double[] eVals;
046
047        /**
048         * Constructor, takes a NxN (square) matrix.
049         * @param A a NxN matrix
050         */
051        public EigensolverNxN(double[][] A) {
052                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
053                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix A must be square");
054                }
055                this.n = A.length;
056                this.ed = new EigenDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
057                this.eVals = makeEigenvalues(ed);
058        }
059
060
061        /**
062         * Creates the vector of real eigenvalues,
063         * marking all non-real eigenvalues by {@code NaN}.
064         * @param ed
065         * @return
066         */
067        private double[] makeEigenvalues(EigenDecomposition ed) {
068                double[] re = ed.getRealEigenvalues();
069                double[] im = ed.getImagEigenvalues();
070                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
071                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(im[i])) {
072                                re[i] = Double.NaN;
073                        }
074                }
075                return re;
076        }
077
078        @Override
079        public int getSize() {
080                return n;
081        }
082        
083        @Override
084        public boolean isReal() {
085                return !ed.hasComplexEigenvalues();
086        }
087
088        @Override
089        public double[] getEigenvalues() {
090                return eVals;
091        }
092
093        @Override
094        public double getEigenvalue(int k) {
095                return eVals[k];
096        }
097        
098        @Override
099        public double[][] getEigenvectors() {
100                return ed.getV().getData();
101        }
102
103        @Override
104        public double[] getEigenvector(int k) {
105                return ed.getEigenvector(k).toArray();
106        }
107        
108        public EigenDecomposition getDecomposition() {
109                return this.ed;
110        }
111        
112        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
113        
114        /**
115         * @param args args
116         * @hidden
117         */
118        public static void main(String[] args) {
119//              double[][] A = {
120//                              {3, -2},
121//                              {-4, 1}};
122//              double[][] A = {        // no real eigenvalues
123//                              {0, -1},
124//                              {2, 0}};
125//              double[][] A = {        // no real eigenvalues
126//                              {4, -1},
127//                              {2, 4}};
128//              double[][] A = {
129//                              {5, 2, 0},
130//                              {2, 5, 0},
131//                              {-3, 4, 6}};
132                double[][] A = {        // 2 real eigenvalues
133                                {5, 2, 0, 1},
134                                {2, 5, 0, 7},
135                                {-3, 4, 6, 0},
136                                {1 , 2, 3, 4}};
137                
138                
139                System.out.println("A = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
140                EigensolverNxN solver = new EigensolverNxN(A);  
141                
142                System.out.println("re = " + Matrix.toString(solver.getDecomposition().getRealEigenvalues()));
143                System.out.println("im = " + Matrix.toString(solver.getDecomposition().getImagEigenvalues()));
144
145                System.out.println("isReal = " + solver.isReal());
146                double[] eigenvals = solver.getEigenvalues();
147                System.out.println("evals = " + Matrix.toString(eigenvals));
148                System.out.println("evecs = \n" + Matrix.toString(solver.getEigenvectors()));
149                for (int k = 0; k < solver.getSize(); k++) {
150                        double lambda = solver.getEigenvalue(k);
151                        if (Double.isFinite(lambda)) {
152                                double[] x = solver.getEigenvector(k);
153                                System.out.println();
154                                System.out.format("λ_%d = %.6f\n", k, lambda);
155                                System.out.format("x_%d = %s\n", k, Matrix.toString(x));
156                                System.out.format("   M*x = %s\n", Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(A, x)));
157                                System.out.format("   λ*M = %s\n", Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(lambda, x)));
158                        }
159                }
160                
161        }
162
163
164}
